data.text: A wise son makes his father glad:
Treasures shall not profit the lawless:
The Lord will not famish a righteous soul:
Poverty brings a man low:
A son who is instructed shall be wise,
A wise son is saved from heat:
The blessing of the Lord is upon the head of the just:
The memory of the just is praised;
A wise man in heart will receive commandments;
He that walks simply, walks confidently;
He that winks with his eyes deceitfully, procures griefs for men;
There is a fountain of life in the hand of a righteous man;
Hatred stirs up strife;
He that brings forth wisdom from his lips
The wise will hide discretion;
The wealth of rich men is a strong city;
The works of the righteous produce life;
Instruction keeps the right ways of life;
Righteous lips cover enmity;
By a multitude of words thou shalt not escape sin;
The tongue of the just is tried silver;
The lips of the righteous know sublime truths:
The blessing of the Lord is upon the head of the righteous;
A fool does mischief in sport;
The ungodly is engulfed in destruction;
When the storm passes by, the ungodly vanishes away;
As a sour grape is hurtful to the teeth, and smoke to the eyes,
The fear of the Lord adds length of days:
Joy rests long with the righteous:
The fear of the Lord is a stronghold of the saints:
The righteous shall never fail:
The mouth of the righteous drops wisdom:
The lips of just men drop grace:
